title: Tottenham quartet set to miss Manchester City match
content:
On the eve of Tottenham 's pivotal away fixture at Manchester City , Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino has announced following training Friday that four first-team players will miss out. 

Central midfielders Ryan Mason , Nabil Bentaleb , Mousa Dembele , and young winger Alex Pritchard will not be included in Pochettino's squad Saturday because of various ailments. 

"All four are close, but all four are out," Pochettino said at the Spurs Enfield training grounds. 

Belgian international Dembele continues to be sidelined with a foot injury picked up during a 0-0 draw with Everton on August 29, while Bentaleb has missed the last four fixtures with an ankle injury. 

Local boy Mason is carrying a knee injury sustained following his game winner at Sunderland , putting a halt to the development of his defensive midfield pairing with Bentaleb. 

Pritchard, who has been on the fringes of Pochettino's first team after spending last season on loan at Brentford , will miss the trip to the Etihad with an ankle issue. 

The injuries have forced the manager's hand, especially in light of the trio of deep-lying midfielders being out, where Pochettino has moved Eric Dier from the back four and into a holding midfield role to mixed results.
